attributes.action: not remove anything from the Equality Bill with regards to churches employing homosexuals and others in Biblically criticised lifestyles.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Many Christians are petitioning against the Equality Bill believing that they should be exempt from showing equality in who they choose to employ, especially with regards to posts such as 'youth worker'. They wish to be able to exclude someone from consideration based on characteristics such as their sexuality. We believe that this is wrong and that no group or organisation should be exempt from the Equality Bill and the important progress that it makes for the rights of many minority groups, especially in this case homosexuals.

Committee stage: House of Lords | 25.01.2010
